intro: Pentanema squarrosum, commonly known as the rough pentanema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, often woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
